intro: Diogenesia andina, commonly known as the Andean diogenesia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to the cold, dry conditions of the Andes. It features compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
